title: aniframe package â€” aniframe
text: S3 class movement data. Creates specialized data frame animal tracking data required columns positional data (x/y/z) time, plus optional columns individual, keypoint, trial, session identifiers.

title: aniframe package â€” aniframe
aniframe package â€” aniframe
text: ... Name-value pairs create columns data frame metadata Optional list metadata .rows Number rows (passed tibble) .name_repair repair column names (passed tibble)

code: aniframe(   individual = rep(1:2, each = 25),   time = rep(1:10, 5),   x = rnorm(50),   y = rnorm(50),   trial = 1 ) #> # Individuals: 1, 2 #> # Keypoints:   NA #> # Trials:      1 #>    trial individual keypoint  time        x       y     z confidence #>    <int> <fct>      <fct>    <int>    <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <fct>      #>  1     1 1          NA           1  0.255   -0.243     NA NA         #>  2     1 1          NA           1  0.629   -0.665     NA NA         #>  3     1 1          NA           1  0.363    0.284     NA NA         #>  4     1 1          NA           2 -2.44    -0.206     NA NA         #>  5     1 1          NA           2  2.07     1.11      NA NA         #>  6     1 1          NA           2 -1.30     1.34      NA NA         #>  7     1 1          NA           3 -0.00557  0.0192    NA NA         #>  8     1 1          NA           3 -1.63    -0.246     NA NA         #>  9     1 1          NA           3  0.738    0.237     NA NA         #> 10     1 1          NA           4  0.622    0.0296    NA NA         #> # â„¹ 40 more rows

Default metadata structure â€” default_metadata
text: Returns list containing default metadata fields initial values aniframe object. fields initialized NA set appropriately data.

title: Default metadata structure â€” default_metadata
Default metadata structure â€” default_metadata
text: named list following fields: source: Data source identifier (character, NA) source_version: Version data source (character, NA) filename: Original filename (character, NA) sampling_rate: Sampling rate Hz (numeric, NA) start_datetime: Start date time recording (POSIXct, NA) reference_frame: Reference frame (factor, "allocentric") coordinate_system: Coordinate system (factor, "cartesian") point_of_reference: Point reference (factor, "bottom_left")

what: Set metadata for an aniframe â€” set_metadata
title: Set metadata for an aniframe â€” set_metadata
text: Sets updates metadata aniframe object. Metadata can provided either named arguments list. aniframe already metadata, new values merged existing values, new values taking precedence. Default metadata fields include: source: Data source identifier source_version: Version data source filename: Original filename sampling_rate: Sampling rate Hz start_datetime: Start date time recording reference_frame: Reference frame (default: "allocentric") coordinate_system: Coordinate system (default: "cartesian") point_of_reference: Point reference (default: "bottom_left")

title: Set metadata for an aniframe â€” set_metadata
Set metadata for an aniframe â€” set_metadata
text: data aniframe object ... Named metadata values (e.g., sampling_rate = 30, source = "sleap") metadata Alternatively, named list metadata. used simultaneously ...

title: Set metadata for an aniframe â€” set_metadata
Set metadata for an aniframe â€” set_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Set metadata using named arguments data <- set_metadata(data, sampling_rate = 30, source = "sleap")  # Set metadata using a list md <- list(sampling_rate = 30, source = "sleap") data <- set_metadata(data, metadata = md) } # }
